summary: The concept of "remuneration by results," commonly referred to as "piece work pay," pertains to a compensation structure where employees are remunerated based on the quantity of work produced or results achieved. This method is significant in personnel management and staff remuneration within EU legal frameworks, as it aligns incentives with productivity. The regulatory implications involve ensuring compliance with labor laws that govern fair pay practices, including minimum wage standards and working conditions. As a redirect to "piece work pay," it emphasizes the importance of performance-based remuneration in fostering efficiency while safeguarding employee rights under EU directives.
